channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023110797
item.description:
Report X-2023110797

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged and leaking and brought to QA where it was inspected and placed in a hazmat bag and drum. DescribePack: Package appeared to be leaking from a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately brought to QA after careful inspection using gloves it was placed in hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023110086
item.description:
Report X-2023110086

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was brought to QA after inspecting package it was placed in hazmat bag and drum. DescribePack: The exterior of package appeared to be soiled from leaking loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon inspection of damaged package, it was promptly placed in hazmat bag and drum.
